column4: i need help setting up my ubuntu box to allow ssh connections, i followed this guide: http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu_Edgy, but I can't seem to connect to my machine
to accept from where? intranet or internet?
i have two other machines on my local network, just trying to transfer files
it's as simple as installing openssh-server, that's all, no need to follow any guides..
i did that, it still won't connect
what command do you issue?
no error, just no response at all
what firewall gui have you used?
I just use the built-in firewall of my D-Link router
ps ax | grep ssh
this is the output of that: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/38411/
it's running then
hostname -i
that outputs 127.0.1.1, should i be using that?
you must set your /etc/hosts
add a line in /etc/hosts as follows
192.168.0.100 name-of-your-machine
okay, ill try that
should i restart a service after changing /etc/hosts or just go with it?
well restart network yes.. the best thing is to use the /system/admin/network gui
still doesnt work with changes to /etc/hosts
see pm
